qas.question: Local associations of a special kind are an amalgamation of one or more Landkreise with what?

answers.text: administrative entities at the district level

qas.question: What are local associations  intended to implement?
What is the association a district-free city or town and its urban hinterland typically grouped into?
What does a Kommunalverband besonderer Art require?

plausible_answers.text: Landkreise with one or more Kreisfreie Städte

qas.question: Who created an amalgamation at the state level?
What do district level associations replace?
Why are district level associations created?
To who are special laws by a district issued?
What purpose is district level administration?

context: <b6_0>Local associations<b6_0/> of a special kind are an amalgamation of one or more <b5_0>Landkreise with <a0_0>one or more Kreisfreie Städte<b5_0/><a0_0/> to form a replacement of the aforementioned <a1_0>administrative entities at the district level<a1_0/>. They are intended <b7_0>to implement <a2_0><b9_0>simplification of administration<b9_0/><b7_0/><a2_0/> at that level. Typically, a district-free city or town and its urban hinterland are grouped into such an association, or <a3_0><b8_0>Kommunalverband besonderer Art<b8_0/><a3_0/>. Such an organization requires <a4_0>the issuing of special laws<a4_0/> by the governing state, since they are not covered by the normal administrative structure of the respective states.
